Recipes.Name: Cranberry Nut Bread
Ingredients: ground flax plus water to replace 2 eggs (or other egg replacer)
veganaise (I've used mock sour cream in a pinch)

Recipes.Name: Chartwell's Tofu Scramble
Ingredients: of coarsely chopped whole peeled garlic

Recipes.Name: Tortilla Breakfast Casserole
Ingredients: shredded vegan cheddar or pepper jack cheese, divided

Recipes.Name: Ma's Oatmeal Scones (Recommended)
Ingredients: chopped dried cranberries or other dried fruits and/or nuts
cup buttermilk (see buttermilk recipe in Toppings, Sauces, and Sides)

Recipes.Name: New Year's Cinnamon Rolls
Ingredients: fresh yeast or active dry yeast or instant yeast

Recipes.Name: Aunt Cris' Banana Bread (Recommended)
Ingredients: flaxmeal + of water. Mix and let sit for a few minutes

Recipes.Name: Leslie Raney's Zucchini Bread (Recommended)
Ingredients: shredded zucchini (I squeeze out some of the water but not all of it)

Recipes.Name: Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread
Ingredients: molasses (I found this was too much)

Recipes.Name: Challah (Recommended)
Ingredients: oil (neutral-flavored such as grapeseed or canola, plus additional for oiling the bowl)
salt (kosher salt or pink Himalayan sea salt)

Recipes.Name: Bagels for the Commune (Recommended)
Ingredients: (500g) bread flour + more for kneading OR all purpose flour (bread flour recommended but not essential)
Toppings (poppy seeds, toasted onion, vegan cheese, sesame seeds, etc)

Recipes.Name: Flatbread Stuffed with Fried Onion, Oregano, and Sumac
Ingredients: oregano leaves; reserve 1 spoonful for garnish

Recipes.Name: Hamburger Buns
Ingredients: non-dairy milk (I used homemade almond milk)
flax egg (1 tbs ground flax seeds + 3 tbs water)
organic coconut oil or vegan butter (melted - to brush over the tops)

Recipes.Name: Flour Tortillas & Tortilla Chips
Ingredients: cup extra virgin olive oil, vegetable oil or other fairly neutral flavored oil

Recipes.Name: FUUL Bowl (Mo's adaptation - Recommended)
Ingredients: Couscous or quinoa or grain of choice
A lemon plus lemon juice (would recommend using a fresh lemon for the kale marinade and garlic sauce and lemon juice for the tofu marinade)
Extra firm tofu, drained and pressed
Veggies of your choice, I'd recommend 1 red bell pepper, 1 yellow onion, and 6-7 brussel's sprouts
Vegan mayo or vegan garlic mayo
About 10 cherry tomatoes, cut in half
A few pickled jalapenos, cut into pieces
Also could be good: Toasted pecans or walnuts, hemp hearts, avo-cilantro dressing, chopped cucumber

Recipes.Name: Zuch Pasta
Ingredients: Coconut cream, or canned coconut milk & use the top layer

Recipes.Name: The Office Wrap
Ingredients: Lemon garlic aioli or a similar aioli (check Toppings, Sauces, Sides section)

Recipes.Name: Kate's Mac n Cheese
Ingredients: Mustard (I use yellow, you can try whatever) (just keep adding it until you like how it tastes)
Non dairy cheese shreds of choice (optional but highly recommended)
Optional add-ins: Chili Powder, Chipotle Powder, Liquid Smoke, Sriracha, Turmeric, Lemon Juice, Vinegar of some sort (I usually don't include an acid at all)

Recipes.Name: Mo's Thai Curry
Ingredients: Red onion (optional; I used one half)
Bell pepper (optional; I used one half)
Tofu (firm, extra firm, silken, try whatever you want to. I did extra firm and I used 1/2 a block)
Veggie broth or water (I used 2.5 cups)
Soy sauce or tamari sauce (I used about 1 Tbsp)
Lime juice (I used half a lime)
Pinch of ground cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes (could also try sriracha)
Yellow Thai curry paste or red Thai curry paste (I used yellow because it's what I had but then I added cumin as well. I used just under 1 Tbsp)
Probably could add some form of sugar (brown sugar, a liquid sugar) but I didn't
I also think crushed peanuts could be nice

Recipes.Name: Jackfruit Curry (Recommended)
Ingredients: vegetable broth (add more at the end depending on preference)
oz. jackfruit in brine rinsed or water
red bell pepper & 1/2 green bell pepper chunked, or whatever veg you have
curry powder ( I did madras & jamacian)
sugar (optional- I think it's fine without)

*Jackfruit- drain brine/water and quick rinse. Then you can either squish each little triangle with your hand to ring out the extra liquid, or you can smash in between a towel. I use my hands cause I hate laundry. Then go through and cut off any hard pieces and any seeds that may have snuck into the can. Honestly, I also do this part by hand because I combine it with the next step which is to pull apart the jackfruit with a fork till it's broken up sufficiently. I just rip off the hard parts & separate the pieces.

Recipes.Name: Kerry's Potato Salad
Ingredients: Potatoes of your choosing, and any amount
Radishes (milder ones, not ones that are that spicy)
Some kind of mustard, not that much
Lots of options for other veggies and dressings, lmk what you come up with

Recipes.Name: Vegan Butter Chicken
Ingredients: For the tofu (or replace with cauliflower):
(13.5 oz) canned full fat coconut milk
Naan (look up recipe if you want)

Recipes.Name: Scott's Sweet Potato Burgers (Recommended) - Makes 6 big boys
Ingredients: (Note: I would recommend doubling if you want leftovers)
can/240 g chickpeas, drained and mashed (this is about 8.5 oz I think) (dried)
can/240 g mixed beans, drained and mashed (dried)
Handful of chopped coriander or parsley
Flesh of a sweet potato, roasted (1 big or 2 small)
Piri Piri sauce (or some other spicy sauce)
Zest and juice of half a lemon
flour (I often double if the batter is still wet)

Recipes.Name: Barley Salad
Ingredients: uncooked barley (or quinoa, bulgar, or grain of choice)
shredded red cabbage (or green if that's what you've got)
shredded carrots (or chopped if you can't be bothered)
fresh minced ginger (I like to use a zester for mine)
red wine vinegar (rice wine works too!)
sesame oil (pretty important not to skip this one)

Recipes.Name: Black Bean and Butternut Squash Burritos
Ingredients: medium butternut squash, peeled, cubed, & roasted
uncooked short grain brown rice (yields: cooked)
One 15-oz can black beans (about 1.cooked), drained and rinsed

Recipes.Name: Black Bean Salad with Corn, Red Peppers and Avocado in a Lime-Cilantro Vinaigrette
Ingredients: 15-ounce cans black beans, rinsed and drained
ears fresh cooked corn, kernels cut off the cob
minced shallots, from one medium shallot
extra virgin olive oil, best quality such as Colavita
lime zest (be sure to zest limes before juicing them)
chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish

Recipes.Name: Mo's Split Pea Soup (Recommended)
Ingredients: Bay leaf if you're feeling fancy

Recipes.Name: Norman's Burgers
Ingredients: Peperoncino (I think like cayenne? Idk we made it up while we were in Italy)

Recipes.Name: Quinoa Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
Ingredients: small green chili, deseeded and minced (for optional heat)

Recipes.Name: Chickpea Mash (good, easy to simplify, easy to make, easy to eat)
Ingredients: Optional: mayo, dijon mustard, fresh dill, relish

Recipes.Name: Pasta Salad
Ingredients: ounces elbow macaroni (use whole grain or gluten-free if you'd like)
medium red bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch dice
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste

Recipes.Name: Creamy Garlic Pasta with Roasted Tomatoes
Ingredients: medium shallots or some onion, diced
pinch each sea salt and black pepper
unsweetened plain nut milk (sub up to with veggie stock, if preferred)

Recipes.Name: Pumpkin-Seed/Cashew Alfredo Pasta (Recommended)
Ingredients: Add peas or spinach or broccoli or other veggies

Recipes.Name: Shiitake Green Garbanzo Patties with Aioli and Roasted Carrots
Ingredients: In a blender or food processor puree all of the ingredients except for the olive oil. With the machine still running, slowly add the oil and blend until emulsified.  Add salt to taste.
lb carrots, peeled and sliced on the diagonal
shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and caps wiped clean
green garbanzo beans, or normal garbanzos
olive oil + more for pan frying

Recipes.Name: Cranberry Walnut Chickpea Salad Sandwich
Ingredients: cooked or (15 oz) garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed
organic dried cranberries (chopped fresh would be great too)
scallions (green onions), thinly sliced, white & green parts
mineral salt & freshly ground pepper, to taste (I used about each)
(1/4 cup) champagne, white wine or cider vinegar (I used Orange Muscat Champagne Vinegar)

Recipes.Name: Falafel Waffles with Truffle Dill Mayo
Spicy Masala Veggie Burgers (they stick together!)
Broccoli Cheese Casserole
Ingredients: large baking potato, about 1 lb., peeled and diced
oz. button mushrooms, cleaned, stemmed and coarsely chopped
short or medium grain brown rice
large broccoli crown, broken into small florets (about 4 cups)
lemon juice, plus more to taste
tsp. white miso paste, optional, but highly recommended
about unflavored soy or almond milk

Recipes.Name: Potstickers
Ingredients: black sesame seeds, toasted (plus additional for garnish)

Recipes.Name: Simple Potato Curry
Ingredients: broccoli and other veggies of your choosing

Recipes.Name: Falafel Sandwich (Recommended)
Ingredients: yellow onion, cut into 3 or 4 chunks
cloves garlic, divided (Leave 2 cloves whole and mince 2 cloves)
head green leaf or red leaf lettuce, ? coarsely shredded
Harissa or other hot sauce, optional

Recipes.Name: Mo's Peanut Noodles (Recommended)
Ingredients: Also good: snap peas, hot peppers, bell peppers, green onion, ginger

Recipes.Name: Uncle Jose's Potato Tacos (Recommended)
Ingredients: Make mashed potatoes (boil potatoes, mash them up, add butter and garlic and salt. If you don't have a potato masher or mixer make sure you boil them all the way or it's gunna be really hard to mash them up with a fork)
Put the mashed potatoes in the tortillas
Put oil (not olive oil) on a pan and put the potato tacos in the oil
Fry them until they're what you want
Add hot sauce, chopped tomatoes, and lettuce

Recipes.Name: Mini Mediterranean Tarts (Good for when having people over, like for Shabbat. Simple to make)
Ingredients: Lay the sheet of puff pastry onto a baking tray and cut into six squares. Then score a border onto the inside of the squares.
In a bowl, mix the tomato puree, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper to make a sauce. Then spread onto the inner of each square.
Put a few of each topping onto each of the squares.
Brush the puff pastry borders with soy milk
Cook for 15-20 minutes at 180? (356?), or until they begin to look golden brown
Serve, they're great hot or cold

Recipes.Name: Burrito Bites
Ingredients: Can also add corn, TVP or meatless crumbles, other veggies, or anything else. If you leave out the cheese, I'd really recommend adding in something else.
In a large pan, warm the oil and cook off the shallots until translucent, then add the garlic and salt and cook for a few more minutes

Add the red pepper and cook until slightly softer, then add the fajita mix and hot sauce and stir in well. Next, mix in the black beans and then the cooked rice. Add the coriander, stir well and take off the heat.
Take out of the oven and serve as nibbles or party food with guacamole and hot sauce!
Spicy, Creamy Cannelloni (recommended - for those of you who ate this on Christmas Eve 2018, this is that recipe)

Recipes.Name: Cannelloni but with green stuff instead of red
Ingredients: cashews (soaked in hot water for at least 20 minutes - actually not necessary if you're in a rush)
premade marinara sauce (really good quality - roughly per jar)
small block dairy free white cheese (grated)

Recipes.Name: Super easy, fast Mac N Cheese. (Recommended)
Ingredients: Veggies if you want some with the pasta

Recipes.Name: Marinated Tofu with Grain Salad for packed lunches (Recommended but lots of work)
Ingredients: small butternut squash (cut into 1 inch pieces)
red red onion (cut into 1 inch pieces)
For the white bean, spelt & pea salad

Recipes.Name: Sweet Potato & Black Bean Enchiladas (Recommended)
Ingredients: sweet potato, peeled and chopped small

Recipes.Name: Sweet Potato and Peanut Stew (Recommended)
Ingredients: medium red onion, peeled and diced
medium sweet potato, peeled and diced
large yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced
jalapeno, seeded and diced very finely
dried black beans, soaked overnight and cooked until tender

Recipes.Name: Spicy Black Bean Taquitos
Ingredients: Guac Sauce (see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides)
Sour Cream (buy or see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides)
cooked black beans or (19 oz - Canadian recipe!) rinsed and drained

Recipes.Name: Southwest Chop Salad
Ingredients: Coconut Bacon (see Toppings, Sauces, Sides - except it's not there yet cuz I'm lazy, so look it up lol)
fresh or frozen and thawed corn kernels
cooked black beans, or (19 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
large avocado, pitted, peeled, and diced

Recipes.Name: Bean & Cheese Enchiladas Verdes
Ingredients: raw cashews, soaked in hot water for 20 minutes
cooked navy beans or (15 oz) navy beans, rinsed and drained
jalapeno chile, thinly sliced and seeded

Recipes.Name: Fajita Fiesta Bowls
Ingredients: Sour cream (see recipe in Toppings, Sauces, Sides, or buy)

Recipes.Name: Seitan (Recommended)
Ingredients: low sodium vegetable broth or water

Recipes.Name: Chicken Salad (Recommended)
Ingredients: cooked or canned chickpeas, drained, rinsed and lightly mashed
ounces seitan (about 1/2 batch if using homemade - recipe above), finely diced
I would tear pieces apart with your hands rather than cutting them with a knife because it gives it a better texture. This is a lot of work, however, and your hands will be sore after.
cup vegan mayo, more or less depending on taste

Recipes.Name: Scott's Soup (Scotch Broth)
Ingredients: soup mix (red lentils, pearl barley, split peas etc)
Heaped tbsp of Jen's veggie broth powder (see Toppings, Sauces, and Sides)
Approximately 1.2 litres of water, but enough to cover all of the veg by an inch or so.

Recipes.Name: Elvia's Chipotle Salsa (Recommended)
Ingredients: Some chipotle peppers from a can

Recipes.Name: Mushroom Gravy (Good for poutine and perogies)
Ingredients: pound mushrooms, sliced or diced however you want
vegetable stock (if making for perogies, add way less)
soy sauce (or use Tamari Soy Sauce for Gluten Free)
fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
kosher or sea salt, to taste

Recipes.Name: Gwen's Amazing Salsa
Ingredients: Two small jalapenos, or other hot peppers like pablanos, seeds removed for milder salsa

Recipes.Name: Mo & Scott's Easy Cheese Spread
Ingredients: apple cider vinegar or some other vinegar
Optional: fresh herbs like parsley, cilantro, basil, dill, chives, green onion, thyme (or dried if necessary); nooch; garlic powder; onion powder; literally anything you want to try

Recipes.Name: Quick Pickle Onions (Recommended)
Ingredients: large red onion, sliced in half and halves sliced thin
fresh lime juice or lemon juice (from 2 limes or lemons)

Recipes.Name: Taco Seasoning
Ingredients: of Pepper (I used white pepper instead of black)
Optional: Red Pepper Flakes depending on how spicy you want it

Recipes.Name: Basil Cashew Cheeze Sauce
Ingredients: vegetable broth or water (or more as needed)
fresh lemon juice nutritional yeast (gives the cheese flavor)
kosher salt (or to taste) + freshly ground black pepper
raw cashews, soaked in water for 30 mins or overnight OR cashew meal from TJs OR almond meal

Recipes.Name: Chipotle Sauce 2.0 (Recommended)
Ingredients: fresh water or more as needed
Combine all ingredients in blender. The smaller your blender the smoother it will be. And the more you soak the cashews. I added more cumin, lime juice, and chipotle pepper.
Put all ingredients in food processor until desired consistency.  Add lime juice.

To a food processor or blender, add the chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and salt and pepper. Pulse until well blended. Drizzle in olive oil until desired consistency is reached (hummus will firm up a little after refrigeration). Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.
Vary in an infinite number of ways...Some add-ins or subs:
hemp seeds or toasted walnuts or pecans
Red pepper flakes, optional (if you want to add some kick)
flaxseed oil or extra-virgin olive oil (more if desired)

Recipes.Name: Parmesan Cheese (no need to follow precisely. Use whatever nuts you want [not peanuts])
Buttermilk
Ingredients: Place lemon juice, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, or white vinegar in a measuring cup.
Add enough non-dairy milk (of your choosing) until it reaches the 1-cup line; stir with a fork or whisk.
Allow mixture to rest for 5-10 minutes.

Recipes.Name: Coconut Whipped Cream
Ingredients: Place a can of coconut milk upside down in the fridge overnight. Get the regular one, not the low fat or light type.
About 15 minutes before you're going to make your vegan whipped cream, put your bowl and your blender beaters in the freezer so they get nice and cold!
While they're cooling down, prepare some nice sliced fruits (I used organic strawberries!), or get your pie out and ready to top!
Open the can and scoop out the thick part, leaving the really liquidy part behind. You'll notice a really nice hard clump on the top of the can, and a decent amount on the bottom too!
Place in bowl and add vanilla and sugar to taste. I added of vanilla and of organic sugar, but we're all different, so add what you think you'll like!
Blend! I used a hand held blender & blended about 1 1/2 minutes or so... and you can see the nice consistency I got in the pictures.

Recipes.Name: Seven Layer Bean Dip (Recommended)
Ingredients: scallions, trimmed and chopped (I always leave this out)
nondairy cheese (I always leave this out)

Recipes.Name: Sour Cream
Ingredients: raw cashews soaked in hot water for 20 minutes

Recipes.Name: Nacho Cheese Sauce (Recommended)
Ingredients: chipotle pepper packed in adobo sauce, finely chopped, plus adobo sauce
ounces russet potato (about 1/2 medium), peeled and thinly sliced

Recipes.Name: Cesar Dressing
Ingredients: raw cashews, soaked in hot water for 20 minutes
grated lemon zest and lemon juice

Recipes.Name: Thousand Island
Ingredients: sambal oelek (chile paste) or hot sauce

Recipes.Name: Coleslaw
Ingredients: raw cashews (soaked in very hot water for 1 hour, or in cool water 6 hours or overnight) OR store-bought vegan mayo (if you use mayo, cut down on the amount of vinegar)
maple syrup (plus more to taste // sub sweetener of choice, e.g. stevia or organic cane sugar)
celery salt (or seeds // if using seeds, add more salt to taste) - I used actual celery
Sea salt and black pepper to taste
packed shredded red or green cabbage

Recipes.Name: Sherri's Snowball Nut Cookies/Mexican Wedding Cookies
Gramma Kak's Caramel Popcorn
Ingredients: I also add almonds, pecans, or peanuts

Recipes.Name: SO GOOD BUTTERNUT SQUASH CUPCAKES THE BEST EVER
Ingredients: To make butternut squash puree, roughly chop up some butternut squash.  Then cook it in the microwave (covered with plastic wrap to keep in the moisture) for about 5-6 minutes until soft. Transfer to a food processor and puree until smooth.  (Or you can mash it with a fork.)
Frosting: (this makes WAY too much frosting, maybe only measure out ? of this)
block (8 oz.) vegan cream cheese, room temperature
lb. powdered sugar (or more/less to achieve desired consistency)

Ingredients: Dark chocolate (chunks, chips, whole bar, idk)

Recipes.Name: Chocolate and Butterscotch Pudding Pie

Vegan pie crust of your choice

Recipes.Name: Pie Crust
Ingredients: flour (can be white or whole wheat or combo of both)

Recipes.Name: Hot Chocolate Cookies (Recommended)
Ingredients: oz unsweetened chocolate (over half a cup)

scant cup unsweetened cocoa powder (plus more for topping)

Recipes.Name: Soft Pretzels (Recommended)
Ingredients: baking soda (this is for the boiling water NOT the dough)

Recipes.Name: Peanut Butter Cookies
Ingredients: cold vegan margarine (I used Earth Balance)*
vegan granulated sugar or coconut sugar

Recipes.Name: Ma's Granola Squares

Recipes.Name: Charoset
Ingredients: medium gala or fuji apples, peeled, cored, and finely diced
walnut halves, lightly toasted, cooled, and coarsely chopped

Manischewitz or another sweet wine (your local store should have Manischewitz and this is what I'd recommend buying. It's usually pretty cheap and it's what you're supposed to drink for Pesach anyway. Although you guys likely won't like it so also get some less sweet wine)
Stir together all ingredients and store at room temperature.
Green Beans with Tahini Glaze for Rosh Hashanah
dandelion honey (see recipe under Sauces/Toppings/Sides), agave, maple syrup, or omit
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

Recipes.Name: Falafel Sandwich (Recommended)

cloves garlic, divided (NOTE: Leave 2 cloves whole and mince 2 cloves.)

Dried hot red pepper flakes to taste (optional)

Ingredients: egg's worth egg replacement, mixed up and ready to go

poppy seeds, ground (measure first, then grind in several batches in a clean coffee grinder until powdery)

Ingredients: lightly salted matzos (preferably the Streit's brand - see note below)
heaping cup chopped pecans (toasted if desired, for maximum flavor - see note below)
sea salt flakes or kosher salt
